questions.question: When breaking down the prompt, what should you do?

choices.answer: Ignore it and write what you want.
Figure out how many parts there are and what's being asked.

questions.question: When writing an essay, how do you start?

choices.answer: Read the prompt, break it down, and organize your ideas.
Support the controlling idea with evidence.

questions.question: What is the part of the introduction that tells the reader what the essay is about?
What are words that smooth between ideas and connect paragraphs?
Which are examples of transition words?

choices.answer: first, then, however, but, in order to

questions.question: Which of the following is the proper structure of an essay?
What are the important parts of a conclusion paragraph?

choices.answer: catch the reader's attention, introduce controlling idea
brings together the evidence, re-states the controlling idea
introduces new ideas and supports with evidence

questions.question: What is a good way to "hook" your reader and catch their interest?

choices.answer: restate the prompt, including your answer, or "claim"
Make up some stuff.  They'll never know.

questions.question: Before turning in your essay, what should you do?

choices.answer: Make sure it says "By: Your Name"
Put a title at the top
read through it, checking for ideas, spelling, and typos

questions.question: How do you use writing time wisely?

choices.answer: break down the prompt, jot down ideas, write, check over
Stare at the clock and play with the organizer
Check Facebook, play some games, take a nap
write a detailed essay on the organizer sheet

questions.question: When typing, what words do you capitalize?

choices.answer: Names, titles, and other proper nouns

questions.question: What are strategies to organize your thoughts before writing?

choices.answer: start with the body paragraphs, come back to the intro later
daydream about popular musicians for 40 minutes
just start writing - it'll come out naturally
jot ideas on the graphic organizer or draw your own

questions.question: Knowing how to write and communicate effectively is an important life skill.
The writing prompt can be separated into what two parts?
Where should a period be when typing?

choices.answer: At the end of a sentence.
Between two sentences.No spaces needed.For real.
